website_summaries.verdict: This rain fly hammock tent is the perfect choice for those who need to purchase a tarp without the hammock.
pros: Includes tent stakes and tensioner lines
Extremely long centerline for supreme weather protection
cons: Complaints that product was shipped without a few key parts

customer_reviews.title: Would not use in the rain without seam sealing first
customer_reviews.text: The tarp is put together quite well however after further inspection the ridgeline stitching has visible micro pinholes from the stitching that did not get sealed entirely that through a good down poor or would allow a significant amount of moisture to pass through. If you do not have a bottle of seam sealer around to seal the ridgeline, I would purchase the snugpak all-weather shelter or the DD 3x3 meter tarp or for a few more dollars.
customer_reviews.author: JJGJR

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because the tarp fabric is pretty durable but the construction is just awful. First day of using it and stuff was falling off. I stretched the stake just a little bit and the metal ring on the corner of the tarp popped off. You would be better off using any other tarp for a wind proof shelter because of this. Just for the sake of internet credibility, I have been in boy scouts for two decades.
customer_reviews.author: E money

customer_reviews.title: Absoulte junk
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst product I have ever purchased from Amazon. I bought this for my son who was taking a kayak trip down the Mississippi river. After they hit rain for two days, the tarp started leaking and was useless. Contacted the company and never got a response. Tried several times over almost a year with no better results.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Hawkings

customer_reviews.title: Great rain fly for a boat
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to rig up as a rain flybon my sailboat. It is perfect for that purpose. I’m stuck aboard at anchor now while it’s pouring rain with 30+ mph wind howling outside but this tarp has allowed me to keep the cabin door open and boat ventilated and comfortable. It’s super lightweight and packs up smaller and than a football but he fabric, stitching, and reinforced line attachment points are super strong. As the wind picked up I kept thinking I should take it down to keep it from being damaged but this is one tough piece of gear and it held just fine. If it ever wears out, I’ll gladly order another.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Proof is in the Using
customer_reviews.text: With tarps the proof of quality is in the using. Reasonably priced at $45/ea. At a weight of 1 kilogram with stakes and lines, this is a bit heavy for a backpacking tarp. There are 8 reinforced eyelets, one at each corner and one at the middle of each side. Two more eyelets at each side or on two opposite sides would have made this more versatile. The short stakes and thin lines are a bit undersized for the 10x10 or larger tarp. This should work well in light wind or less and moderate rains. If you want something more rugged, I recommend paying more.
customer_reviews.author: paititi

customer_reviews.title: I must have got the Perfect One....
customer_reviews.text: I have the new style grommets, sewn in plastic ones. Held up great so far, 2 yrs anyways and mostly in N.Ga/Tenn/N.C. and we get lots of rain real fast and "unexpected " . Last 2 weeks it rained 11 putts 13 days and it never failed to keep gear dry. Actually back to get a larger size..I'm impressed with quality and evidently they listened and addressed the grommet issue with early models. And I have the snakeskin as well. Good gear. Hasnt failed me. It's my first and its surviving teaching me....it can hold lots and lots of water if it's not erected correctly or reconfigured for a storm before leaving camp....and not leak a drop.
customer_reviews.author: Bad Habit

customer_reviews.title: Well put together
customer_reviews.text: First time hammock camping and used the chill gorilla as my tarp. It did not rain, thankfully, even though it was supposed to. But for being my first time setting one up it was okay. Unless i am doing it wrong, I wish there was enough line for one solid ridge-line instead of coming off of each point. I was able to use some paracord to create the ridge-line to my liking but most tarps do not seem to come with metal steaks so that is a bonus. Good quality and covered the entire double EVEREST hammock and was not worried about getting wet at all.
customer_reviews.author: J.Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, Learned Some Things
customer_reviews.text: My first tarp, and while it hasn't endured a rain test, it seems good quality and it fits back in the bag/sack (which is a seldom mentioned, but very nice feature). I bought it with my eyes open, so I have no complaints because I received what I bought. However, on my first setup, with a ridgeline off-center, I realized that: (1) I really wanted 2 additional stakes (I do really like the stakes that came with it): and (2) I wish it had 2 more grommets on each side (centered between the existing ones). Lesson learned for my next tarp purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tepin

customer_reviews.title: I would happily buy this again, so I did !
customer_reviews.text: My favorite versatile camping tarp. Yes, there are more expensive tarps like this, but unless you set and break camp 100 times a year and year after year, this will work well for most average campers. I did experience heavy wind and rain while using this tarp and it performed flawlessly. It dries reasonably fast, all but the edges which takes a little longer than the tarp itself. Addendum: A year later I bought a second one to expand a camp site set-up. Yes, I'm satisfied, if that tells you anything. I am aware there are higher grade camping tarps on the market, but until I see a first hand reason to upgrade, these have and will meet expectations.
customer_reviews.author: C. U. Later

customer_reviews.title: Best rainfly tarp we have ever had!!
customer_reviews.text: Took on a very wet camping trip. Even during the worst of the down pour it was bone dry under this tarp. The stakes were also better and easier to use than any that we already owned for our tent. The rest of our campsite was not so lucky, everyone was hiding under this tarp as soon as it began to rain hard. Even when the inside of the tarp was touched it stayed dry (just a teensy bit of condensation - extra humid weather)
customer_reviews.author: Crystal Thronesbery

customer_reviews.title: NONE BETTER
customer_reviews.text: Im an Outdoors Man #ngoodfellow55 on instagram. Of all the rainflys I've used in my life I would Never use another Rainfly besides Chill Gorilla and thats a Fact. I backpack all over the World from Iceland to Mexico and everywhere between and My Chill Gorilla goes with me on every single Adventure. My Rainfly is used on average 40x a year in and out setup and take down in -30F weather in Canada to 105F weather in Death Valley and Chill Gorilla has Proven itself to me to be The Best Rain-Fly Bar-None.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wouldnt call this waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Tarp construction seemed decent for the price, the stakes were lightweight, the tarp was a good size, unfortunately the first night I used this tarp it decided to rain, this tarp was not waterproof. as soon as the rain started I could see small droplets of water forming on the inside of the tarp, it didnt seem like a big deal, a few hours later I awoke to large water droplets falling on my face occasionally, the sleeping bag was damp luckily just on the outer shell since it was only 38 degrees. I wanted to like this but if I cannot trust it to keep water out during the rain, its useless.
customer_reviews.author: vtbilly

customer_reviews.title: Good shelter
customer_reviews.text: Bought this last spring and wanted to take some time to review it. I’ve used this on many solo back country trips to set up various shelter configurations. There’s a lot you can do with this, because of all the tie outs. It has proven to be waterproof so far. However, I do plan to seal the seams prior to using this spring. The color was a little lighter green than expected, but that certainly didn’t affect its ability to shed water and block the wind. It’s also fairly lite, considering it’s size. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Leaked....  quality issue.  Please refund or replace.
customer_reviews.text: This tarp leaked. We only used this tarp on ONE camping trip. The other one we purchased (the blue one) was fine. As you can see in the pictures the seal on the taping separated along the center seam. I think this is a quality issue. I'm happy to edit my review if the manufacturer will address this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Don Chapin

customer_reviews.title: If it hadn't started leaking I'd give it 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: While I love the coverage, the air circulation, and waterproof material, the seam has started to leak in 2 places after about 8 uses. It's a relatively small leak, but in torrential, overnight rain storms, it's no fun waking up cold because you're soaking wet. If it hadn't sprung a leak, it would be 5 stars, but because it did I have to give it 3.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Head

customer_reviews.title: Multi-use durability and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Gorilla rain fly for a Utah Camping trip and it was a life saver. The quality was tested in strong gusts of wind and rain while also keeping me cool under the hot sun. - Very strong stitching - Quality design on the corners and loops for anker points. - Lightweight and compact when stored in the pouch. I used bungee cords instead of the provided cord and tent stakes. I believe the bungee cords allowed the tarp to survive the gusts of wind better then a tight cord. Looks like my friend will be purchasing one as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hartsook

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the item
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the item.. item was delivered quickly and is exactly as described. I've since used the tarp 4 times, NONE of which have been in the rain.. I DO NOT know how it will work in the rain but it seems pretty trustworthy. It packs down small and fits back into its own bag no problem. The ONLY downside I've found so far is that the item is NOT black, it is a dark gray, with a black gorilla logo. This doesn't bother me at all but it is not black if that is what you are looking for
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Light weight and excellent quality nylon tarps
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised at the good quality . This tarp is as light weight and manageable as a rain fly, with excellent water proofing imbedded in the nylon fabric. These make excellent walls for shade canopies, emergency tarps to cover a damaged tent and tarp covers to protect gear from bad weather. I would highly recommend them . There are several tie down positions along the edges as well as a hanging loop in the center. They are not at all like the woven poly tarps you see at all the retail outlets, that discolor and rot after a couple years.
customer_reviews.author: Masked Crusader

customer_reviews.title: Covers me and all my stuff easily and effectively.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace the rectangular fly that came with my hammock. I currently have it in the small Chill Gorilla sleeve, but I think I'll probably just go back to using the stuff sack it came in, as it packs smaller, that way. While mine's never been rained on, yet, it definitely keeps me dry in a heavy dew. Sets up and breaks down easily, packs small, lightweight, and strong!
customer_reviews.author: Clayne T. Bedsole

customer_reviews.title: Bomb-proof!
customer_reviews.text: I said this tarp up over my hammock because there was a 30% chance of "scattered showers"... Their "scattered showers" seemed more like a hurricane at the time... The tarp held up amazingly! Broke 2 guy-lines but the D-rings and stitching held strong! So, upgrade your guy-lines if you're planning to camp in "scattered showers"! HAHAHA!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not have center guide loop
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this months ago and finally got to try it out. Very big tarp and seems well constructed. I noticed in the pic that it shows a center guide loop. Mine does not have this. Would be very handy to have to keep the center up with a ridge line instead of having to using a makeshift button and anchor.
customer_reviews.author: jim

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used this tarp yet but it is of good quality and the price is right. The seller gave me a list of tips and tricks and some links to some YouTube videos, my husband and I sat and learnt how to tie knots for hours, even though the tarp came with tensioners. Can't wait for spring to put this and our new skills to good use
customer_reviews.author: Candice

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but functional (kind of)
customer_reviews.text: Isnt a bad product. Read the reviews before hand and pretreated so itd actually be waterproof. Held up decent but its extremely heavy compared to other rain fly's. Like way heavier than most of the stuff you carry on your pack. Also the paracord lines that come with it dont particularly function well so I ended up tying off my own before my hike. Also, to the company, the giant gorilla logos y'all put on their are a freaking eyesore and it will make you the butt of the joke on the trails. As I said. Not a bad product when you put the extra effort into it.
customer_reviews.author: Korbin H.

customer_reviews.title: Unvelievable Value
customer_reviews.text: My son’s getting into the outdoors so I bought him a complete setup from Chill Gorilla consisting of a hammock, rain fly and bug net. All are AWES:OME! The 10’ rain fly is impressive with 2 reinforced ridge lines, ripstop nylon, and 10 tie downs. The aluminum stakes are basic and we planned on upgrading the stakes anyway so no problem there. It’s a top notch rain fly and unbelievable value.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Jake

customer_reviews.title: I liked that I had a number of options for hanging ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for some hammock camping and the very first night I carried it we got some rain. I liked that I had a number of options for hanging it, plenty of string as well as anchors. The size was also nice because it completely covered my hammock and allowed me to hang my pack off the end of the hammock and keep it dry as well. I was very happy with the tarp and I stayed 100% dry.
customer_reviews.author: W

customer_reviews.title: Great sized tarp. Will eventually have to swap out the stakes though.
customer_reviews.text: Size of the tarp is really nice, and I do like all of tie downs (the loops?). It kept the wind out very well, I didn't get any precipitation so I can't vouch for its waterproofness. The guy lines are nice with the tensioners. Actually, I did have a couple of missing lines with my order, I contacted the seller and they sent me out a whole pack of guy lines right away! My only issue with these is that the stakes are quite easy to bend so be careful when hitting them into the ground.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy set up and it does the job
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 13 year old to use with boy scouts. We tested it in the yard first. He wasn’t thrilled with the triangular setup and was much happier with the rectangular one. He slept under it that night. Bugs got him but he felt good about the cover. It wasn’t difficult to set up and will be easier next time now that the strings are tied on. He was worried it wasn’t big enough but it seems like it is. It does cover the hammock but we haven’t tried it in the rain yet. Rain might sneak in the ends unless knots or clips are used to stop the direct access down the line into the hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Carlton X

customer_reviews.title: The center loop was great to prevent water from pooling and causing the tarp ...
customer_reviews.text: This tarp held up to a strong rain storm, keeping a bunch of campers and gear dry as we waited for the rain to stop and ate dinner. The center loop was great to prevent water from pooling and causing the tarp to sag, and the other loops are strong enough to be tied tightly to trees. It's also lightweight and packs into a small bag, so easy to carry on backpacking trips.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Enthusiast!

customer_reviews.title: Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This tarp has performed well. I have been in conditions where temps are 28 and winds sustained of 20 with higher gusts. Have had it up in thunderstorms that concerned me, and it performed very well. Con: While I like the top hang points, it is not compatible with other Chill Gorilla products like bug netting. Not a deal breaker, just have to run a different ridgeline. Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Just arrived today and it looks awesome and I can't wait to try it out hammock ...
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived today and it looks awesome and I can't wait to try it out hammock camping sometime soon. Seems to be very high quality. Update: Have used multiple times over hammock. Works flawlessly! Very nice construction. So far, I've only used in light rain conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t be happier
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making shelters with. It was pictured black in the photo however when mine arrived it was grey. However no complaints from me I prefer the grey. It came with 4 stakes and cordage to hang it. Tarp also has solid construction and has the rip stop squares. For the price you can’t beat it
customer_reviews.author: T_MM_O

customer_reviews.title: Came in handy
customer_reviews.text: Came in handy on a disastrous canoe trip ! A damn near hurricane came whipping down the river valley over night. This tarp held up well; however, you gotta keep it TAUT ! If water allow to pool up anywhere, it will saturate and "seep" through. Other than some seepage in a windstorm, held up good ! A few more grommets would be nice.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Why it's not 5 star worthy
customer_reviews.text: Why isn't this five stars? Only a couple things turned me off but the tarp itself is really nice and durable. 1st thing is it's extremely heavy for being a 10'. 2nd thing is the lines are extremely cheap accessory cord will be replacing with 550 and they have plastic hardware on the lines ( will be replacing with hornets from dutchware). It has six tie downs but only 4 aluminum stakes (bummer). All in all it's a good tarp after a couple mods. Can't complain about the price either.
customer_reviews.author: T1me2Adv3nture

customer_reviews.title: Kept cool in the hot sun!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I did some beach camping last week. Where we camp, you're given a campsite in the woods and one actually on the beach. This tarp performed without flaw! We got heavy down pours and we had some serious sun too. This tarp kept my wife dry in her hammock during the rain and cool when the sun was beaming down on us. She had no complaints, so neither do I. I'll most likely be buying a second tarp very soon.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you get all of the parts!
customer_reviews.text: So far it’s holding up has only been light sprinkles so far though. Two stars because it only came with three ground stakes and four tie down ropes (suppose to be four and six). Sadly I didn’t do inventory sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Customer service was shat! But desent tarp.
customer_reviews.text: I'd have ranked this way higher if shoever i dealt with when i had issue didn't talk to me like I was mentally challenged. The tarp works fine, bag in comes in is weak at best (wired coating inside coming off after few uses and not sized properly) as are the stakes (broke1 first time I used in fairly soft dirt just by pushing with foot no hammer)
customer_reviews.author: W.B.Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Great for rain
customer_reviews.text: I worked for a wilderness therapy program and was out backpacking for 2 weeks at a time in the rainforest, mountains, and coast of the PNW. This tarp kept me dry and it packs small! You can cowboy camp under it and be fine except in summer when there’s bugs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good sunscreen, terrible rain tarp
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight tarp with very good tie outs on the corners. Handled extreme wind fine with no tears. Sets up ok in the classic a-frame, but cannot get tarp taut in a diamond setup. Sags on either side of the ridge line. Tent stakes are very fragile because of the multiple notches cut for line retention. Leaks badly under almost any amount of rain. Went hammock camping with 4 others. All their really inexpensive $6.00, poly tarps kept them and their gear dry in the same conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Kuper

customer_reviews.title: These are toys, not camping equipment.
customer_reviews.text: The stakes and guy lines included with this tarp are toys, not camping gear. The stakes are about as big around as a #2 pencil. The guy lines are cheap cord about the size of #36 bank cord. They are not paracord. I doubt thes fixings would hold in a stiff breeze, let alone a thunderstorm. I can get better cheap Chinese junk @ Walmart for 1/4 the price. Returning this disappointing dross for a refund...
customer_reviews.author: Phat Dong

customer_reviews.title: ... holes and tie off spots to do all those cool tarp setups that i saw on utube
customer_reviews.text: it didnt have enough grommet holes and tie off spots to do all those cool tarp setups that i saw on utube, the holes that the thing did have for stakes were too small for anything but the absolute weakest spikes, but i did weather a storm in in and can attest to the fact that the fabric is waterproof. And the gorrila sticker that it came with looks good on the shop fridge.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon E. Parker

customer_reviews.title: MY SECOND CHILL GORILLA TARP
customer_reviews.text: I was recently sent a hammock for review and need a rainfly to go with it. I've purchased a Chill Gorilla tarp in the past and was impressed with the quality given its low cost. These Chill Gorilla tarps are equal in quality with my original Chill Gorilla tarp. Double stitching all around with sealed seams, quality tent stakes, and tie down cordage. You can't go wrong with these tarps.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher B.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tarp for shade or rain shelter
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a camping trip I had planned in Spring and we ended up getting rained on the first day. This was the first thing I set up and we hung out under it for a few hours and ate lunch. It really saved the day. It seems very durable (rubbed a bit on a tree and no visible wear has been spotted on the tarp). I am going to order another to use as an additional rain fly/shade for my tent.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Clark

customer_reviews.title: Budget friendly Ultralight option.
customer_reviews.text: Initially impressed with the tarp. Durable and lightweight. I also enjoy the plastic tie outs that'll come in handy on trail. It also seems to have come with more than enough cordage, although I prefer my Kelty shepard hooks to the 4 provided. I also want to treat it with a waterproofer just to be safe, and I'll report back when the weather warms up and I can take it backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: Works as it should
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on one camping trip so far and it didn't rain, so I waited until a thunderstorm was approaching and set up at home. It held up well under moderate winds, size and shape was sufficient to keep the rain off, and I could touch it without water coming through, unlike some "waterproof" tent rain fly's. Video was taken after the weather had actually let up quite a bit. Only change I've made is to add some lightweight carabiners to make it quicker/easier to attach the cords to the stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy S

customer_reviews.title: Good rain fly
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I highly recommend it. The only negative thing I have to say is the ropes are definitely not reflective. You have to be careful with it in the dark. But I used it in the boundary waters and it held up great as a rain fly. First setup is a learning process but once you figure it out it goes fast.
customer_reviews.author: Cecily

customer_reviews.title: ... I noticed my camping trip was going to include good chances of rain and storms
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after I noticed my camping trip was going to include good chances of rain and storms. Set up was simple but solely based on figuring out distances between trees and covering the area that we wanted dry. I was able to keep a picnic table and 3/4 of a hammock dry as well as one camping chair. Held up well, did have very minor dripping from the seam of the middle loop but it was pouring for over 6 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A pretty good tarp considering the price
customer_reviews.text: I like the tarp, I see why it was Amazon's choice. A pretty good tarp considering the price. Weight claimed of 1.4lbs for the tarp is somewhat accurate... Just the tarp with stuff sack weighed 1.6 lbs (733grams) and the accessory pouch weighed an additional 4.5oz (128grams). I absolutely do not like the ground stakes because they are near impossible to push into the ground by hand, I much prefer the wire style of stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Straight Forward Review

customer_reviews.title: Does not work well in heavy rain without a ridge line!
customer_reviews.text: This rain fly works well for light to light- medium rain. I spent the weekend out hammock camping and it started raining pretty heavily, shortly after water began to come through the tarp and drip on me. Needless to say, it was not an enjoyable experience. For clarification, I had the tarp suspended in a diamond shape and it was held up by 2 points on either side and staked into the floor. Since I didn't have a ridge line it began to sink and collect water then drip. This may have been user error but thought I'd mention it.
customer_reviews.author: armando

customer_reviews.title: Used this fly the same night that I received it held back the wind and the rain like a champ
customer_reviews.text: No issues with the seller. Item is as described and arrived quickly. Used this fly the same night that I received it held back the wind and the rain like a champ. It covered my hammock and I well.
customer_reviews.author: Alan W.

customer_reviews.title: Peelin' Feelin'
customer_reviews.text: This thing was practically glued together!!! like... bandaid tape! It was a weird feeling!! Thought i was gonna rip it!!! Man i was wrong.... good luck ripping this monster lol its fine now. I used it a few times and i am sold sold sold.
customer_reviews.author: James Q.

customer_reviews.title: Super great
customer_reviews.text: I love my chill gorilla. It was weathered multiple rainy days and nights without a single leak. Bits versatile and sturdy. I hope to have plenty of adventures with this awesome rainfly
customer_reviews.author: Rphill

customer_reviews.title: I was in the market for a good camping tarp and was pleasantly surprised when it got ...
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought this by accidentally clicking buy now. I was in the market for a good camping tarp and was pleasantly surprised when it got here. It’s very large - came with everything pictured - the color is exactly as pictured (I received the tourqoise)- and it arrived one day early. I will likely buy another in a different color. Only reason for 4 stars is I haven’t taken it outdoors on any trips yet. Just a setup in the yard so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very happy camper.
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this rain fly. It is well constructed and really durable. I like the fact that on the tie outs you have 2 options to choose from you can stake it out with the loops or you can guy it out with the tabs I think that makes this tarp very versatile. This tarp is perfect as the intended rain fly but it also makes a great shelter from the weather. I would definitely buy one again but I don't see this one wearing out any time soon.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Great price, excellent construction, rugged materials!
customer_reviews.text: My rain fly arrived in excellent condition and on time. It comes with guy lines, stakes, and a nice carry bag. I used mine in the diamond configuration, setup was easy and the guy line tensioners stayed tight all weekend, even after a small storm. I fashioned a pole out of some deadfall to prop up one end and funnel the breeze over my hammock.
customer_reviews.author: Dan33

customer_reviews.title: Cheap or defective ?
customer_reviews.text: Center tether point ripped 2 days into camping. Making it almost useless. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: B. Loring

customer_reviews.title: Centerline Strap Broke
customer_reviews.text: It's a great tarp, this is the second one I've purchased. Unfortunately with this one, the centerline strap ripped off during the second use. No pressure on the line, it was just hanging. That strap is the main reason I purchase these tarps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Survived a huge storm!
customer_reviews.text: Best damn hammock cover I have ever used. Went through a severe thunderstorm last weekend with winds over 50 mph and hail. Cover stayed in place and hammock was still dry! Thank you for making such a great product. Chill Gorilla might be the best products that I have ever found. These are quality products. This rainfly just survived a four day hike where we endured thunderstorms every night, twice with high winds....it never had a problem! Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice rain fly. This is large and covers the hammock with plenty of room to spare. I've used a competitors rain fly at 9ft and it barely covered what was needed. Easy set up as a diamond, have not tried the rectangle. I was considering ordering the 12ft, but I'm glad I didn't because this provides more than enough coverage for me. Even my straps stay mostly dry. I'm hooked on this rainfly. Good product and no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: ToddRG

customer_reviews.title: Good build, but NOT waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: Initial impression: good build quality. The stakes are hefty and the grommets are very nice. One major shortcoming.... It's NOT waterproof. Waterproof means water will not go through it, and I had water dripping on my face all night even though this was over me. Water seems to permeate through the tarp and drip whenever there is the slightest crease. I'm going to try a waterproofing solution, but I'm not happy that I even need to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Chaky31

customer_reviews.title: Great product and fantastic customer service
customer_reviews.text: Tested in my backyard in the pouring rain, kept me dry. Great product and fantastic customer service. I think I'll buy the 12' fly too though. The 10' just BARELY covers the doublenest in the tent/ rectangle configuration. (Caribiners were sticking out the end) The diamond configuration will cover you fine though. I like having the full coverage, so I might end up going with the 12. But fantastic quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product. I had been waiting to buy a ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. I had been waiting to buy a rain fly for my hammock. It’s great to see such a quality product available at this price. I use it on my Eno DoubleNest and it fits perfectly. I wish I had a reason to buy another!
customer_reviews.author: DoctorScort

customer_reviews.title: Plastic tie down rings could be better, seems well constructed outside of that.
customer_reviews.text: Second time using it one of the plastic rings on the end broke when using a stick as a toggle to suspend above our camping area. The rest of the tarp held up fine, and I was able to still use it despite the broken ring, I just attached a loop of rope for that tie out. It's a good sized tarp in a decent size stuff sack, and seems to be built pretty well outside of the plastic tie down rings.
customer_reviews.author: Merrick

customer_reviews.title: A great way to protect yourself from the elements.
customer_reviews.text: I have set this tarp up a couple of times. It appears easy to work with and very versatile in a number of configuration. Tie out points are well situation for ease of setup. Compact and light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Poindexter

customer_reviews.title: The guide ropes and hardware could be better but the cost being where it is it is ...
customer_reviews.text: Have not used yet but I have inspected them. Definitely please with the price. Quality seems to be superb for the cost. The guide ropes and hardware could be better but the cost being where it is it is exceptable. The stakes that came with it look to be sturdy and well made. Overall pleased with the cost and quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Pro 2nd Amen

customer_reviews.title: This product is great! It's lightweight
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! It's lightweight, durable, and easily packs up. Customer service is fabulous! I thought my fly was smaller than advertised. They said to just send them a picture of the fly being measured and they'd make everything right. Welp, the fly was a perfect 10 feet. Ha! I had this fly set up for over a month during summer weather -- heat, wind, and storms. Stayed secure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big and effective
customer_reviews.text: It fully covered my not-small hammock (below) and had plenty of decent stakes (which did not bend!) / ropes / etc to get the job done. Not much else to say - cheap and effective, I'm happy with the purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Groxx

customer_reviews.title: I'm Now a Chill Gorilla Fan!
customer_reviews.text: I am looking at buying more from Chill Gorilla as this tarp is very nice for the price. I set it up with my Castaway hammock and it covered nicely. All materials are better than my Family's Ridge way tent (4yrs old). Multi hang options is one of the reasons i bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Shawnm

customer_reviews.title: Versatile camp shelter
customer_reviews.text: The tarp arrived on time as scheduled and the material is lightweight, yet durable and easily packed into the stuff sack supplied. So far, I only set it up once and everything looks good. Will need to do a seam seal process prior to taking it out for camping.”
customer_reviews.author: Majanie

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me dry and happy
customer_reviews.text: I use this tarp with my hammock when camping or just to get some shaded/dry space when outdoors. It's survived a few big storms and I'm confident that it will last for a very long time to come. It's very lightweight and quite compact, which makes it great for hiking or just regular camping. Nothing bad to say about this thing- except that I wish I could use it even more often! :D
customer_reviews.author: Snyman

customer_reviews.title: Gets the Job done
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use in conjunction with my hammock. Ive used it twice now, and have stayed dry both times. Wish I had bought one that was slightly longer, but it works well
customer_reviews.author: Rachel P.

customer_reviews.title: Great tarp that is well worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: This tarp is just what I was looking for. The quality and workmanship is great, especially for the price point. I would like to see the same tarp come in a version with 19 tie-points instead of just 9, and price that tarp accordingly. That would allow many more configurations, make the tarp more versatile.
customer_reviews.author: SaltyC

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, very large when fully opened, lots of ...
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, very large when fully opened, lots of anchor points to configure different ways. Ordered a second one for my daughter. Had to update, I’ve only used this maybe a dozen times. The center tie down ripped completely off, still intact so it was a sewing problem. This is the center one that goes over the ridge line, so it’s pretty important. And yes it was windy, but not enough to justify that happening.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great, cheap, needs instructions
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to the hammock camping game, so I bought some budget gear. It works great, I can't speak on hard use or longevity. Seams top notch for the money. I wish it cane with instructions, that's my biggest complaint. Again I'm new to this stuff, but helpful set instructions would really help.
customer_reviews.author: 2k11Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Love at first site
customer_reviews.text: I have not got to use mine yet, as it is way to cold out now. but I went camping with a buddy a few weeks ago and he had one. I was so jealous when he pulled this out I looked at it all weekend and knew this is what I was looking for. he said he has had his for 3 years or so and has not had a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: Duckhuntercm

customer_reviews.title: You need to decide between weight and quality.
customer_reviews.text: A little bit heavy for the back pack. Very good quality though.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Rose

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than it seems, wish it were a little ...
customer_reviews.text: Bigger than it seems, wish it were a little smaller but better a little too big than too small. 10x the price of the hammock it goes with but also 10 times the quality of the hammock. Update - My Chill Gorilla Rain Fly had a manufacturing defect but Chill Gorilla replaced my tarp and shipped me a new one free of charge. Great customer service! I would definitely do business with CG again.
customer_reviews.author: C.R.

customer_reviews.title: Usable though not super light, or super strong
customer_reviews.text: Ok lightweight tarp. Center pull tab popped off in first real use, and then began leaking there some, but otherwise decently waterproof and adaptable design and size. Reasonably light, though not a real ultralight style. Wish it had a few more tie-out strings and stakes
customer_reviews.author: D. Skau

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Finally camped with this. Perfect length for a hammock. I can't vouch for the water resistant. I think I set it a little low, but I'll get it higher next time--hammock may have been too high.
customer_reviews.author: Scoutmaster Steve

customer_reviews.title: Hammock cover
customer_reviews.text: Used for a shade/ rain cover while hammock camping, worked amazingly. Plenty big enough to cover my whole hammock. Didn't block all the light but kept a nice shade and the short light rain off of me. Packs back down into its bag essily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have no complaints.
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints. This fly held up to several hours of heavy rain with strong gusts of wind. No leaks, no damage. After shaking off the remaining drops and pooled up water, the fly dried out completely in no time at all. Fast enough to take it down and pack up to leave the camp after breakfast.
customer_reviews.author: IMe&Myself

customer_reviews.title: I'd get this one
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Size is awesome. Packs up small. I sealed the seams right off per other reviewers recommendations. Only comes with 4 stakes my only issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rick Helms

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I wish it were just a little bigger, maybe 12x12. As you can see it barely covers my skeeter beater hammock, but it is a large hammock. I've used this tarp on two trips and it has blocked wind and rain effectively. My one gripe is the stuff sack, it really needs to be waterproof so your tarp doesn't get the rest of your gear wet.
customer_reviews.author: Josh318

customer_reviews.title: Fun and dry
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to use the product yet. Because of the cold weather in montana,BUT my husband is itching to try it out so I am going to set it all up somehow this weekend. The directions given and the hints for better longer usage are excellent. Buy one and have fun.
customer_reviews.author: christi Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Compactable and light weight
customer_reviews.text: Very compactable and light weight. The stakes are durable and tie out points are well made. Wish it had a few more tie outs on the sides. Mine only came with one on each corner, one in the middle of each side and a center tie out. Used this as a lean-to shelter over my tent. The heat from the fire rolled right into my tent and was very comfortable in 24 degree weather. I pulled, wrenched and stretched this tarp with no issues. Also love that it is very easy to fold back up into its pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Aaron Fennell

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping.
customer_reviews.text: Great rain fly. Well built. Includes everything you need. Easy to set up. I used this while camping for 2 weeks in Lake Tahoe. While I was there, it rained and there ended up being hail the size of quarters. It was enough to dent the hood of the car but the rain fly stayed put, didn’t take on any water, and my sleeping bag stayed dry! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: JustinGaylor

customer_reviews.title: great rain fly
customer_reviews.text: the rain fly worked great in the rain with no water leaking through, the only things i would change is the rope that came with it was not the greatest and none of it was long enough for where i was camping. and the stakes are not the strongest.
customer_reviews.author: Eah

customer_reviews.title: Great deal.
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I’m not giving it 5 stars is that 4 of the stakes bent or broke on the first use. Granted it was rocky ground in the Adirondacks, but they shouldn’t have bent so easy. Tarp is excellent and tie out points are robust unlike some other tarps. Tarp held its own during heavy snow and winds around 20 mph sustained with gusts in excess of 35 mph. Definitely recommend especially at the price. Get some good groundhog stakes to pair with it and you won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: 5/3/1 guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner.
customer_reviews.text: I waited until I'd had a chance to use this rain fly while actually camping, and I found it to be great. I've never hammock camped before, so my experience with equipment is limited, but the fly was easy to set up and place, with all guylines and stakes in great shape. My only complaint is that there are six guy lines and four stakes...not sure why, but it's kind of annoying having to use a found stick or rock to tie off the last two guy lines. I would definitely recommend this fly for beginner level hammock camping, because that's the level I'm at, and I found it perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! Nice quality!!
customer_reviews.text: The tarp itself has held up great so far. Unfortunately and what I was expecting, the stakes have started to bend :(. The tarp is however very strong and was withstanding a few desert rogue windstorms. I was truly excited to see that the adjustable tent poles ( I bought fit perfectly thru the slotted ends. Highly recommend this tarp, will update if this changes!
customer_reviews.author: Patch

customer_reviews.title: Couldnt find a better tarp for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I havent field tested this tarp yet, but its better quality out of the box than i expected, including the stakes and included line. The stakes i got were aluminum spade stakes much better than what is pictured. My only complaint right now is that the center tie-outs are to one side of the center seam. Would like to see this changed, but otherwise, looks to be a great value for a budget kit (like mine)
customer_reviews.author: J.K.B.

customer_reviews.title: Great Rain Fly, somewhat cheap stakes
customer_reviews.text: The rain fly has worked great so far. I've used it a few times with a little bit of light rain. I've had no problems with the fly itself, but one of the stakes broke after the 2nd time using it. I can't say I was overly aggressive, but it still just snapped on me. Overall, I'm happy with the purchase and consider the weak stake as an unfortunate fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: affordable rain fly for hammock
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this hammock in rainy day. So I can't make a appraisal for waterproof. But it is affordable and good and lightweight. - after one month - I used this tarp 3 times after I received. It was torn 2 places. It seems to be scratched by tree branch. I think the tarp so weak. So I am looking other 10*10 tarp of good quality and reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Jong Tae Lim

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Got scammed by all the fake reviews. Tarp completely leaked on me while on a long hike...luckily it was only one night of rain or it could have been a really bad situation. This thing is going in the trash....
customer_reviews.author: Justin C.

customer_reviews.title: Seems nice but CAMO is not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Seems nice but CAMO is not as advertised, not worth the extra few dollars. they also dont seal the seams prior to shipping, made in china
customer_reviews.author: Maya

customer_reviews.title: Nice tarp for your money.
customer_reviews.text: It's not an Aqua Quest tarp and it's not $100 either. It's fairly stout and the seams could use a little work but, it kept the water off and sfayed in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Sockwell

customer_reviews.title: Will not last.
customer_reviews.text: Waterproof coating doesn’t last. I used it 5 times and the coating is melting off the nylon. Sent email to the company and my claim was rejected. I’ll look for something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Durishan

customer_reviews.title: so the delivery was super fast. This rain fly did an awesome job ...
customer_reviews.text: Just went camping in my hammock for the first time this weekend. Got this product just in time, so the delivery was super fast. This rain fly did an awesome job keeping me dry... I slept next to the river and had no problems with dew. It was a good size, and the materials felt well made and of high quality. It felt light, but really durable. It came with all the accessories to put it up... the stakes were better than the ones that came with my friends tents! I recommended it all weekend. Plus, the price is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Theshelbstinator

customer_reviews.title: My experience
customer_reviews.text: So I wanted to wait until I got a chance to use it before leaving a review as most ppl should. I recently went camping for a week up in the mountains of North Carolina and as suspected it rained and it rained hard. Overall the rainfly did pretty well. But due to the amount of rain it did bleed through some and a few things got a little damp but over all I would say that I'm happy with it
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Upset
customer_reviews.text: I have returned it because it us not suitable to use in the mountains in raining day. It doesn't really give protection. If you use it in bavk yard. This is fine.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great size without the weight.
customer_reviews.text: Love the roominess of this 10x10 tarp! Set it up as a rain fly over my hammock or pitch it as a low tetra on the ground. Plenty of space without a lot of weight!!
customer_reviews.author: Wade Kaple

product_meta.title: Chill Gorilla 10x10 Hammock Rain Fly Camping Tarp. Ripstop Nylon. 170" Centerline. Stakes, Ropes & Tensioners Included. Camping Gear & Accessories. Perfect Hammock Tent. Multiple Colors.
feature_bullets: WATERPROOF RIPSTOP NYLON FABRIC CHARACTERISTICS: Lightweight, durable, tear & puncture resistant. Ideal for rain flies because it will not fail under stress.
WATERPROOF CAMPING HAMMOCK TARP & TENT COVER with 2 centerlines, 9 tie downs & square design gives you more coverage & setup options. Military soldiers love our Rain Fly / Tent Tarp. SURVIVAL GEAR
TRUST OVER 500 REVIEWS! Whether you are hiking, camping, backpacking, or on a motorcycle our lightweight rainfly will protect you from rain, wind, bad weather & provide shade from the hot sun!
EASY TO SETUP. Use as ultralight rain tarp, emergency shelter, tent footprint or camping canopy. Easily covers double hammocks w bug net & underquilt, tents, & shelters. REVIEWS SHOW EVEN MORE USES!
CHILL GORILLA CRUSHES THE COMPETITION. Compare to Hennessy, dd tarp, Gold Armour, Tera Hiker, Redcamp, ENO, Kelty, Bushcraft, Outad, Aqua Quest, Wise Owl, Free Soldier etc. BEST VALUE FOR YOUR MONEY!
HASSLE FREE WARRANTY: Please register on our website or contact our customer service team. We answer ANY question in less than 24 hours. Copy-paste this link into your browser: http://amzn.to/2f1wPOB

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
